snippet: The rich have pulled away from the average American, but those beyond the 1 percent have pulled away even more.
abstract: Incomes of the top 1 percent of American households have pulled away significantly from those of the bottom 90 percent over last three or four decades, but even larger gap called 'fractal inequality' has emerged at very top of the scale; extremely rich tend to cluster in big cities and are much more likely than 99 percent to have graduate degree or college education.
lead_paragraph: The rich have pulled away from the average American, but those beyond the 1 percent have pulled away even more.

headline.main: Even Among the Richest of the Rich, Fortunes Diverge
